description.narrative: The Project-level impact of the new investment is expected to have economy-wide effects by generating jobs and economic linkages to other sectors. In addition, it will also have stakeholder effects by providing better access to finance for end customers (farmers). At the market level, the project has the potential to promote competitiveness as the Company can have a strong demonstration effect in the market for other competitors to replicate its high efficiency operations.

The proposed investment is to support JSC Concern Galnaftogaz (GNG or the Company), an independent distributor of transportation fuels based in western Ukraine, by providing a long-term corporate loan to finance the Companys 2020-2022 capex and working capital needs (the Project). GNG is Ukraines largest company in retail distribution of transportation fuels in terms of sales volume and third largest by number of filling stations. As of December 2019, the Company owned and operated 357 OKKO-branded filling stations. In 2019, GNG sold 849 thousand tons of petroleum products (incl. LPG) in the retail segment, generating total EBITDA of US$151 million on US$1.6 billion of revenues. The Project includes the following components: (i) working capital to develop GNGs Farmer-Supply Program (FSP) and other agricultural related permanent working capital, (ii) improvements in GNGs logistics infrastructure; and (iii) growth and improvement capex fuel stations network, including the installation of electric charging stations.
